Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Looks like a red wire.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hmm. It wasn't here before.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well it's a computer Dwight, computers have wires.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yours doesn't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Doesn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, it's going in a different direction then the other wires.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, I am really busy, I can't talk about this anymore. [Dwight follows red cord through office past Phyllis' and Stanley's desks]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Dwight, get out of here!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I got 500 feet of red wire at a flea market up by Dunmore High School. 20 bucks for the whole spool. Crazy, what a deal. [behind Jim, Dwight climbs telephone pole] Oh he'll be fine. I made it up there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What you talking bout, Wallace? [imitating What you talking bout Willis]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Hi Michael how are you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi, I am well, how are you?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: So listen, as you know, we haven't yet filled the regional supervisor job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, have you not?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Correct. And I was wondering if I could get you to do some of the field work that would normally go to the supervisor [Michael makes exaggerated oh-my-gosh face at camera]. There is an area from Carbondale to Marshbrook, where we have never done any business.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: There is a small company there, Prince Paper. I can't get a report on it because it's not a public company. But we have been talking about going after their market, so I was hoping you could do some fact finding for me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I'll fax over some of the things we're looking for.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fax, why don't you just send it over on a dinosaur?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Look, this is important, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, well, then, email it to me.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You've got no taste Stanley Hudson.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, I do.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What are you guys talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Some actress, whether shes hot.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Who is the gal in question?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hillary Swank.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Ah, Hillary Swank.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [most of office huddles around print out of Hillary Swank, judging her hotness] Not at all.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: She's got mean eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Have you seen her with her bangs?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: She looks like a monster.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Guys, she is a beautiful movie star, so maybe we should just go to work.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: She is an amazing actress.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That is not the question.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: She's not hot.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, thank you Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, okay, okay. Why don't we just put this to a vote, and then we'll be done with it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm not voting.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [snaps back] No one cares. Who thinks that Hillary Swank is hot, raise your hand. [half of office raises hand] Okay, and who thinks Hillary Swank is not hot, raise your hand. [other half of office raises hand]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [counting votes] Five. Five to five.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you, accounting department.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So what do we do now?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [riding in car with Michael] What if the owner of Prince Family Paper has a beautiful daughter and we have to seduce her in order to get their secrets?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will seduce her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I wanna seduce her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I will seduce her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please Michael, please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I got it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You'll fall in love with her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, so what if I did? That would take precedence and I would expect your support.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, let's go over the plan again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, I am a local business owner. [Dwight nods along] I need to buy paper. I find out everything about their prices and policies

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Your fictitious name?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Michael Scarn.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am a paper salesman looking for a new job. I find out everything about their expenses and salaries.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Then we meet at the Denny's...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [interrupting] No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...and then we compare notes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, I never said Denny's. IHOP.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! [arguing over each other]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know how I feel about IHOP.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, don't start,

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you socialist?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? I don't want to get into this debate again. I enjoy IHOP.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll have a cup of a coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You will have pancakes and you'll like it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Store only has three employees.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It means they are not expanding.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe they are shrinking.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They could be shrinking.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No because their sign is centered perfectly above their store. No sign of the sign being moved.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah ha [popping something in his mouth] Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [spying through binoculars] Its lunch time, and no sign of anyone coming in or out. Which means they are not taking new customers out to lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm hmm .

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Which Means they're not acquiring new business. So once again no growth.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And there are clouds. There are clouds in the sky, which means gonna rain, bad for business.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, it would if they were all cumulous and not cirrostratus.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Argh, why are you all...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get your clouds right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shut up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So you go in now, I am going to go in exactly ten minutes. We have never met each other. We are complete strangers. Also, we are going to need a signal to bolt out of there if there is danger. Lick ur lips, try it. [Michael licks lips] No, no like this. [Dwight starts and Michael follows passionately licking their lips] Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ready to do this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Here come the sharks. [they imitate jaws theme sounds and Dwight makes shark fin on his forehead]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In nature, there is something called a food chain; it's where the shark eats a little shark. And the little shark eats a littler shark. And so on and so on. Until you get down to the single cell shark. So now replace sharks with paper companies and that is all you need to know about business.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Entire Prince family
Quote.Text: Hello, hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My name is Michael Scarn. I am a local business owner and I would like to find out about your company.

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: Oh, please come in

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: What kind of business are you in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We are a law firm.

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: I assume your primary paper needs are stationary, general office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, I will be honest with you... about something. Where we used to live, our paper supplier had a lot of big clients and I just didn't feel like a priority. So I guess my question [reaches for paper in his pocket with questions on it] for you would be [reading off sheet] how many clients do you have?

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: About 80.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? That many? This doesn't seem like a very big operation.

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: It's just me, my wife and my son.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, so when did you set up shop?

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: I opened this place after I came back from Vietnam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh Vietnam, I hear it's lovely .

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: [muted] Mmhmm. [shrugs]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Each side will have three minutes to prepare opening arguments. Topic:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, even specialty paper, say 94 brightness double-bonded, you would put that on the same truck as your conventional stock?

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: You sure know a lot about paper for a lawyer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well that is... because... I am a genius.

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: Oh really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, well about some things, and other things I am very stupid. Like, watch this. Is this the cup? [picks up tape dispenser and makes drinking motion] Is this the cup? [picks up a stapler and makes drinking motion] Is this what I drink out of? [glug noise, both laugh] Laughter is my job, tears are my game, law is my profession.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello, I would like to apply for a job.

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: Hi, I'm afraid we're not hiring right now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why don't you just get rid of this guy? [points to Prince Son]

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: That's my son.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm your son now; you can visit him on holidays. Dwight Schrute, I'm a paper salesman at a second tier paper company called Dunder Mifflin. I'm the top salesman there and I'm looking for a new challenge. I would say you guys have what, 40 high full volume clients?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Try 80.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pshaw, that's nothing. I've 90 clients myself. You had better look out, someone might run you out of business.

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: I sure hope not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Me too. [smirking]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think all of us have a tendency to view celebrities as sort of mythical figures, you know? We don't really see them as real so therefore we don't judge them as real people.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Are you serious? Jim, just show us a picture.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Kevin, c'mon.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, shut up Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: He's making all these fancy, uh, it's a gut thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Kevin, you know what, why don't you close your eyes? Imagine that Hilary Swank comes into this office for real and she walks over to you [in a more and more seductive voice] and says Kevin Malone, I just read your online profile and there is nothing I would rather do then make out with you right now. And now you tell me something, is she hot? [Kevin gets up to join the "hot" team to their great joy] Does that end the debate?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [Kevin sits down, gets right back up and heads back to "not hot" team] No, it's is she hot, not would you do her. Respect the game.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [fingers opened an inch] This close.

Quote.Speaker: Prince
Quote.Text: Grandfather:

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ladies and gentlemen, even though the penis was fake, I was expecting a second plot twist where we found out Hilary Swank was a boy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [disapprovingly] Kevin!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ok, I wasn't going to dignify this discussion by getting involved, but I don't even get the discussion, hot is a temperature people. But Kevin deserves to lose for what he said, so, yes, she's hot, she's hot as heck, she's a female Boris Becker.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OH! [the "yes she's hot team" claps]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, well thank you very much for all of your help. It's going to be an incredibly hard decision.

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: Wait; let me get something for you. Here is some, some references. Here is a list of references, our top clients. You call any of them; I trust you will hear some good things.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... Okay, okay, okay, [in disbelief] alright, thank you. [heads towards Dwight, makes make out lips signal]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [both making make out lips at each other] Excuse me sir, I took the bus here and was wondering if I could catch a ride home with you in your car.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Of course. Thank you very much. Thanks for your time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I cannot wait to contact your clients.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you for your time I look forward to getting your calls. [hurrying out door]

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: Bye bye now. So long.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight and Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God. [running out door]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Haha, we struck the mother load!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cmon.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wallace is going to freak.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All their top clients I can't believe it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He's going to absolutely freak.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Someone's looking out the window. Go go, Peel out, go. [car hits front divider, screeching]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh shoot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You drove over that. Go back [car hits divider, screeching]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh God, what was that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's not good.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No, no, no no. Shes hot, okay? Because if you are saying Hillary Swank isn't hot, then you are saying that I am not hot. Because obviously I am not as hot as Hillary Swank! [Kelly runs away in tears]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Aw, it's alright.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh man,

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Aw, my car.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not good.

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: Is everyone okay?

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandmother
Quote.Text: It sounded bad.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No no, we are fine. You have done enough already.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You've done more then you can possibly know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just, shut up. You know we are just going to call a tow truck, so...

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: A tow truck is going to charge you one hundred bucks to take you a mile. Let me take a look.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, really not necessary.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He drove over the divider and then backed over it and caused the..

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: I'll be right back I'm just going to grab my tool box.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ladies, are we prepared to let the Kevins of the world decide anything for us? Anything at all? We don't even give him full internet access.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [surprised] Wait, what?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: See that, the obvious symmetry of the face? That's a natural appeal of the scientific standard of coin aphelia, features that are a composite average of many features. Yes, she is attractive, but is not hot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How much longer is this going to take?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know let me give you some money for this.

Quote.Speaker: Prince Son
Quote.Text: No, I work at a desk all day, its nice working with my hands.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh coffee, that's too much. [Dwight drinks it]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is disgusting, what is it this, instant?

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: Well that outta do it. [bumper is heavily duct taped to the car]

Quote.Speaker: Prince Granddaughter
Quote.Text: Its all better.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Prince Grandfather
Quote.Text: Gosh, well so long. [they exchange byes]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I look forward to hearing from you about that job application.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, goodbye Prince Family.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Goodbye prince family, [to Michael] should be called the Sucker family. Here you go shark, let me fix your fin for you and sharpen your teeth while I'm at it. [Dwight laughs evilly, Michael seems remorseful] Bye bye.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [punches Michael on the arm, beckons to Michael for high five, does not get it, high fives himself, smiles contently]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [entire office is chatting] I'm saying, all I'm saying is Kevin is not necessarily a feminist, is all I'm saying.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, because... [Dwight and Michael walk in and march into Michael's office, silencing the conversation]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, what will happen to that family if I call David and give him this information?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Its simple, David would use that information to destroy them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. You know, our sales are fine. We're doing fine. They're doing fine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They could do better.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't we just, live and let live?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Live and let live.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not familiar with that expression,

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's from James Bond.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It doesn't make sense, of course I'm alive.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not going to make this call.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, you have to. Have you ever seen a lioness devour its cub? Have you ever seen a baboon devour its mate? Have you ever seen a raccoon devour a squirrel?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My heart says...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Your heart is a wonderful thing, Michael. But it has made some terrible decisions.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is true.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is true. We have gone down the wrong path many many times.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jan... Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, save your heart for love, and use your brain for business, right? If we don't do this to prince paper, someone else will. Worse yet, someone else will do it to us.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I am trying to be more optimistic in life. I've got what, 20 or 30 years left. And my family history says I have less. Now, the old Stanley Hudson would have found something wrong this actress. But that is no way to live life. Look at this healthy sexy pretty strong young woman. C'mon people! She is hot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There was a terrible war, ugh, so many died. Far too many died. But if Frodo hadn't destroyed the ring, then goodness itself might have died.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are right. I will call David and give him the customer list and I will give him all my info.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good, so, [Michael takes client list and heads out of office] where are you going?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just something I have to do first.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where are you taking the client list?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Somewhere safe, where it can't hurt anyone [starts running, Dwight follows]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, Michael, no. Michael, give that. Michael, don't do this. No. [chasing Michael out of the office into parking lot]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh shoot! [gets to his car turns around]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Freeze, give me the list! [still chasing him back into office where Michael grabs his car keys from his desk and heads back to parking lot]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No no no, I can't let you do this!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Those people will be ruined. [runs out back door]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Its business, not personal. [they run back outside, where Dwight gets paper from Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give it, give it. We can't do this to those people.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Its over, Michael, its over. [holding list of clients up]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not a shark.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, it is time for the final votes. All of those in favor of resolution Hillary Swank is hot? [half of office raises hand] Okay. And all those opposed? [he skips back and joins other half of office in raising hand]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: This is ridiculous.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's the thing about debating, you're just going to get people more entrenched in the view they had in the first place. [two sides of the debate start arguing]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: This is good stuff Michael. You are a titan of industry pal.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [pained] Mpfh.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Good work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Look I'll be in touch, thanks buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, bye bye.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Guess whose stock just went up, golden boy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I guess this is what they call a bittersweet moment. It is bitter because I slightly destroyed a wonderful little family. But sweet because David Wallace thought I did a good job. That's what I hate bittersweet chocolate. I don't even... what's the point of that? Why not just sweet? Who are you helping?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hey what is this?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hillary swank.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, she is hot. ["Hillary Swank is hot" supporters cheer]
